verses.text: 先知首次疑問哈巴谷先知所得的默示。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'
A grammatical structure indicating 'what is (verb)ed'
Lit. 'silent revelation'

verses.text: 耶和華啊！我懇求，你不垂聽，要到幾時呢？我向你呼叫「有狂暴的事」，你卻不拯救。

words.note: Lit. 'bend down to listen', often used for deity listening to prayers

verses.text: 你為甚麼使我看見惡行？有奸惡的事，你為甚麼見而不理？毀滅和強暴在我面前，紛爭和相鬥常常發生。

words.note: Verb with resultative complement

verses.text: 因此律法不能生效（「律法不能生效」原文作「律法鬆懈」），公理無法彰顯。因為惡人把義人包圍，所以公理顛倒。

words.note: Forms '無法' (unable, no way to)

verses.text: 耶和華的回答你們當看列國，要定睛觀看，就會大大驚奇，因為在你們的日子，我要作一件事，即使有人說了出來，你們也不會相信。

words.note: Reduplicated for emphasis
Directional complement indicating emergence

verses.text: 就是要興起迦勒底人，那殘忍兇暴的民；他們遍行全地，佔領別人的家園。
他們恐怖可怕，自以為義，趾高氣揚。

words.note: An idiom, often used in religious/moral contexts.
An idiom describing someone strutting proudly and acting arrogantly.

verses.text: 他們的馬比豹更快，比晚上的豺狼更猛。他們的騎兵奔馳，自遠而來；他們如鷹飛翔，迅速吞噬。

words.note: Connects clauses or phrases, often indicating sequence or contrast.

verses.text: 他們定著臉面向前，齊來行暴，擄獲戰俘多如塵沙。

words.note: Often used metaphorically in biblical texts for countless quantity.

verses.text: 他們戲弄君王，以掌權的為笑柄；他們嗤笑一切城堡，築壘攻取；

words.note: 的 nominalizes '掌權' (to hold power) into 'those who hold power'.

verses.text: 然後掃蕩如風吹過。他們是有罪的，因他們以自己的勢力為神。

words.note: Implies thorough destruction or eradication.
Often used in structure '以...為...' (take ... as ...)
Here refers to 'a god' rather than 'God' (耶和華).

verses.text: 先知第二次的疑問耶和華我的 神，我的聖者啊！你不是自古就有的嗎？我們不會死的。耶和華啊！你派他們行審判。磐石啊！你立他們施懲罰。

words.note: Capitalized 'S' in pinyin to indicate referring to the one true God.
Often used in literary or formal contexts.
Also used in legal contexts, e.g., 'court judgment'.
Figurative for stability or a strong foundation, common in Bible.

verses.text: 你的眼目純潔，不看邪惡，不能坐視奸惡；為甚麼見行詭詐的人而不理？惡人吞滅比自己公義的人，你為甚麼緘默呢？

words.note: More formal/literary than 眼睛 (yǎnjīng).
Implies watching passively without intervention.
Similar to 邪惡, but often implies deceit or treachery.

words.definition: to heed, to manage, to care about

words.note: More vivid and literary than just 'destroy'.
More formal than simply '不說話' (bù shuōhuà).

verses.text: 你竟使人像海裡的魚，像無人管轄的爬蟲類。
迦勒底人既用鉤把他們釣起來，用網拖走，用魚網收聚在一處，就歡喜快樂，

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating it is disposed of or acted upon.
More formal than '收集' (shōují).
An idiomatic expression meaning 'very happy' or 'full of joy'.

verses.text: 向自己的網獻祭，對魚網燒香，因他們藉此收穫豐富，飲食充裕。

words.note: A traditional form of worship or veneration.

verses.text: 這樣，他們倒空自己的網，毫不留情地繼續殺戮列國。

words.note: Connects an adjective/adverbial phrase to a verb.
Often implies large-scale or brutal killing, common in biblical texts.
Often refers to Gentile nations or the nations of the world in biblical context.
